result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary E Thompson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Voir Dire @ Jury Trial on 6/19/17
Closing Arguments @ Jury Trial Held 6/19/17
Opening Statement @ Jury Trial Held 6/19/17
3rd written correspondence from the deliberating jury - request for reading of a portion of transcript
4:25 p.m. Same appearances as jury trial. DA asks for costs; states rationale. Defense asks for 1 set. Court orders costs - 1 set. 60 dtp or pay plan.
Guilty, both counts 1 and 2
No exhibits offered, only marked
2nd question from the jury and response from the Court.
Question from the jury and response from the Court.

Defendant Zachary E Thompson in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. 24 jurors have been signed in and sent to voir dire. 9:11 a.m. Panel sworn for the beginning of voir dire with 18 jurors subject to voir dire questioning. Jury selected and sworn at 10:40 a.m. Opening remarks. State's first witness, Deputy Nisavic, sworn and questioned. Mid-day break at 11:30 (while Court called other cases/lunch). 1:00, trial resumes with Deputy Nisavic's testimony continuing. At 1:27, State calls witness, Det. Pilla. (Jury out for legal sidebar discussion and arguments on the record). 1:37, with the jury, Pilla sworn and questioned. 2:05, State rests. 2:08, of the presence of the jury for instructions conference and Court's colloquy with Def. Defense rests. 2:31, back with the jury, Court administers instructions prior to closing statements. Closing arguments. Deliberations begin at 3:07 p.m. Written question from the jury received and answered by the Court at 3:23. Second question from the jury answered by the Court at 3:53. 4:10, jury brought in for reading of transcript (redirect of Deputy Nisavic). Verdict received and read at 4:23 p.m. - guilty both counts.

IN CHAMBERS-Jury Draw has not yet begun. Jury instructions have been distributed. Judge did take language from criminal complaint, modifying the language. 
No objections to jury instructions by both parties. No motions in limine filed or to be filed. Judge will determine number of convictions of def during trial. Atty Harper states there will be no motions and stipulations, will be testimony and evidence instead.  Moving for sequestered (Det. Pilla). Judge will be allowing open voir dire. 
Atty McDougal states one of the jurors is the mother to defs children. Court will strike her by stipulation of both parties. At 23 jurors now (possibly 24) and need 23 jurors for a criminal misdemeanor case. 
Atty McDougal states defs medical issues and request accommodation, court grants.

Defendant Zachary E Thompson in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Final details discussed. Court instructs counsel to review jury instructions prior to Monday morning. Counsel note stipulation re the test. 18 jurors will be seated for voir dire; counsel each to exercise 3 strikes; no alternates as this is a 1-day trial.
and jury instructions

Defendant Zachary E Thompson in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. DA notes this matter is set for jury trial; is still headed to trial; State has no unusual motions; stipulation for no analyst; trial can be done in 1 day. Atty. M concurs - states voir dire wide open. Counsel agree that this is a 1-day trial. Court notes state study and, based on recommendations, notes that 27 reporting jurors should be enough to select the jury. Instructions due 2 days before final pretrial trial. 6/16 for final pretrial.

Status conference on May 31, 2017 at 11:00 am.
Final pre-trial on June 16, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
Jury trial on June 19, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Zachary E Thompson in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Atty. M asks for jury trial scheduling; State has made an offer that is unacceptable to the Def. Court would like State to determine availability of the analyst. DA says that the sample hasn't been sent yet so lab wouldn't be able to determine that. Court sets the following and instructs DA to find out about analyst's availability: JT 6/19, FPT 6/16 at 2, and final stc 5/31 at 11. Motions and jury instructions due 5/31.  Jury trial scheduled for June 19, 2017 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 16, 2017 at 02:00 pm.  Status conference scheduled for May 31, 2017 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on April 12, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Zachary E Thompson in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. DA states offer has been extended; asks for reset. Plea not yet entered.  Def enters NG pleas.  Status requested and set.  Status conference scheduled for April 12, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on February 15, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Zachary E Thompson in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  DA states parties have a resolution.  Atty. M states offer has been received; not quite ready for resolution.  Adj. to 2/15 at 9 for AIA - plea not yet entered.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 15, 2017 at 09:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on January 11, 2017 at 11:00 am.
No appearance by defendant
Attorney Lisa A McDougal appears for defendant. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  DA Harper asks for WA, to be stayed until January 11th at 11:00am.

Adjourned initial appearance on December 15, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Zachary E Thompson in court. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Court informs def of rights including right to counsel.  Def contacts SPD - eligible.  Matter adj.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 15, 2016 at 11:00 am.
